summary: A corporation (the taxpayer) protests a letter ruling from the Taxpayer Information & Education (TI&E) Section of the Department of Revenue declaring that it is providing a dating service and should have been collecting and remitting retail sales tax and reporting retailing business and occupation (B&O) tax rather than service and other activities B&O tax. Holding: TI&E was correct in concluding that the taxpayer is providing a dating service that is subject to retail sales tax.
